item.description:
The Boston Comic Con (www.bostoncomiccon.com) is being held Saturday & Sunday October 24-25 from 10am-5pm at the Back Bay Events Center (180 Berkeley Street, Boston, MA). The cost of admission is $10 for the day. I went last year and it was somewhat small as convention go; I got through the entire convention in a little over an hour. There were comics and comic related items for sale as well as some very good artists scattered around drawing. You can check out the link for a full list of artists that will be there- I've put some of the artists I'm personally interested in seeing below.

If anyone is interested in catching a drink or something afterward, let me know. I'm not familiar with the area in terms of venues, but we can play that by ear if people are interested.


STEPHANE ROUX

Making a trip across the Atlantic to showcase his talent at the BOSTON COMIC CON - STEPHANE ROUX is a HOT French comic book artist who is known mostly for his cover work for MARVEL, DC and SEMIC comics. He has worked on such titles as WITCHBLADE: BLOODOATH as well as SIBILA and STRANGERS in the SEMIC pocket publications-His most recent works have included cover artist on BIRDS OF PREY, and COUNTDOWN TO FINAL CRISIS for DC comics. Letâ€™s show this continent hopper what a real AMERICAN comic show is like!

MIKE McKONE

MIKE McKONE has penciled many titles including JUSTICE LEAGUE OF AMERICA and JUSTICE LEAGUE INTERNATIONAL and PUNISHER WAR ZONE for MARVEL COMICS.- However it was his work of Marvel's EXILES which brought him instant attention, and led him to work on DC's TEEN TITANS and Marvel's FANTASTIC FOUR. - His most recent credits include AMAZING SPIDER-MAN and is working on covers for DEADPOOL: SUICIDE KINGS and PUNISHER.

KHOI PHAM

The BCC is proud to bring to the city KHOI PHAM, one of MARVEL COMICS' finest artists; A superstar who is considered to be one of Marvel's "YOUNG GUNS. From X-FACTOR to the INCREDIBLE HERCULES to his whirlwind run on the SECRET INVASION flashback chapters of MIGHTY AVENGERS - it is hard to believe that Khoi has had no formal training! - Come meet this artist whose career in the comic field may have come quick, but by no means will it be a short one. Welcome to Boston, KHOI PHAM
